patterns.regex: SYN flood|port scan|multiple SYN packets|unexpected SYN-ACK|PROTO=TCP.*SYN|half-open connections|connection timeout exceeded
patterns.description: Detects SYN flood attacks where multiple SYN packets are sent without completing the TCP handshake.

patterns.regex: connection timeout|partial HTTP request|incomplete headers|stalled connection|multiple partial requests|request timed out
patterns.description: Identifies Slowloris attacks where connections are kept open with partial HTTP requests.

patterns.regex: HTTP/2.*RST_STREAM|GOAWAY frame|multiple stream resets|stream error.*cancel|rapid connection reset|HTTP/2 reset flood
patterns.description: Detects HTTP/2 Rapid Reset attacks where many stream reset frames are sent.

patterns.regex: ACK flood|multiple ACK packets|unexpected ACK|PROTO=TCP.*ACK|excessive ACK packets|ACK.*without data
patterns.description: Identifies TCP ACK flood attacks where large numbers of ACK packets are sent.

patterns.regex: TCP zero window|window size: 0|window closed|window update 0|PROTO=TCP.*win 0|flow control|tcp window full
patterns.description: Detects TCP Zero Window attacks that exploit flow control mechanisms.

patterns.regex: IN=.* OUT= .* SRC=.* DST=.* .* PROTO=UDP SPT=53 DPT=\d+ LEN=(\d{3,})
patterns.description: Detects DNS amplification attacks with large UDP packets from DNS port 53 to non-standard ports.

patterns.regex: SQL syntax.*?error|incorrect syntax near|syntax error at or near
patterns.description: Detects SQL injection attempts triggering database syntax errors.

patterns.regex: unclosed quotation mark after the character string|quoted string not properly terminated
patterns.description: Identifies SQL injection attempts with unclosed quotes.
Matches SQL injection patterns in URLs or parameters.
Detects inline script tags or event handlers in user input, indicating potential XSS attacks.
Identifies XSS attempts using javascript:/data: protocols or malicious functions.
Matches XSS in image or iframe tags with javascript: sources.

patterns.regex: failed login|authentication failed|invalid password|access denied|login attempt failed|401 Unauthorized
patterns.description: Detects unsuccessful login attempts, potentially indicating unauthorized access.

patterns.regex: multiple failed login attempts|repeated login failures|account locked|too many login attempts
patterns.description: Detects brute force attacks via repeated failed logins.

patterns.regex: suspicious activity from IP|blocked IP|blacklisted IP|IP address flagged
patterns.description: Identifies activity from flagged or blocked IPs.
Detects Local/Remote File Inclusion attempts targeting sensitive files or directories.
Matches directory traversal attempts targeting sensitive files or directories.
Identifies command injection attempts.
Detects API abuse via 4+ rapid, successful requests.
Detects probing with 3+ rapid requests.

patterns.regex: missing CSRF token|invalid CSRF token|CSRF token validation failed
patterns.description: Detects missing or invalid CSRF tokens in POST requests.
Flags POST requests lacking CSRF token validation.

patterns.regex: session fixation|invalid session ID|session token mismatch|unexpected session change
patterns.description: Detects session manipulation attempts.
Matches Remote Code Execution attempts.

patterns.regex: denial of service|resource exhaustion|too many connections|connection limit exceeded
patterns.description: Identifies general DoS attacks.
Detects XML injection attempts.
Matches Server-Side Request Forgery attempts.
Detects automated bot or crawler activity.
Detects HTTP flood attacks targeting port 80.
Detects denied network traffic.
Detects denied ICMP traffic.

patterns.regex: ICMP flood|ping flood|excessive ICMP echo|PROTO=ICMP.*TYPE=8|multiple echo request|ping of death
patterns.description: Detects ICMP flood attacks where targets are overwhelmed with ICMP Echo Request (ping) packets.

patterns.regex: ICMP.*broadcast|smurf attack|amplified ICMP|ICMP echo reply flood|multiple ICMP TYPE=0|PROTO=ICMP.*TYPE=0.*LEN=(\d{3,})
patterns.description: Identifies Smurf attacks using broadcast ICMP traffic for amplification.

patterns.regex: ICMP fragment|fragmented ICMP|incomplete ICMP|PROTO=ICMP.*INCOMPLETE|overlapping ICMP fragments
patterns.description: Detects fragmented ICMP packet attacks intended to bypass security controls.
Identifies ICMP timestamp request/reply attacks used for reconnaissance or time-based exploits.

patterns.regex: ICMP address mask|PROTO=ICMP.*TYPE=17|PROTO=ICMP.*TYPE=18|address mask request|address mask reply
patterns.description: Detects ICMP address mask request/reply attacks used for network reconnaissance.
Identifies ICMP redirect attacks that can manipulate routing tables.
Detects UDP-based amplification attacks using various protocols like NTP, DNS, SSDP, etc.

patterns.regex: UDP fragment|fragmented UDP|incomplete UDP|PROTO=UDP.*INCOMPLETE|overlapping UDP fragments
patterns.description: Identifies fragmented UDP packet attacks designed to evade detection.

patterns.regex: connection limit reached|too many connections|max connections exceeded|connection queue full|connection table full
patterns.description: Detects TCP connection-based flood attacks exhausting connection tables.

patterns.regex: PSH-ACK flood|PROTO=TCP.*PSH ACK|multiple PSH packets|excessive PSH-ACK|PSH flag abuse
patterns.description: Identifies floods of TCP packets with PSH-ACK flags set.

patterns.regex: FIN flood|PROTO=TCP.*FIN|multiple FIN packets|excessive FIN|unexpected FIN packets
patterns.description: Detects floods of TCP FIN packets without proper connection teardown.

patterns.regex: RST flood|PROTO=TCP.*RST|multiple RST packets|excessive RST|connection reset attack|unexpected RST packets
patterns.description: Identifies floods of TCP RST packets designed to disrupt connections.

patterns.regex: slow POST|HTTP POST.*slow|content-length mismatch|incomplete POST data|slow upload|request body timeout
patterns.description: Detects HTTP SlowPost attacks where POST requests are sent very slowly.

patterns.regex: slow read|client read timeout|read rate limit|socket read timeout|slow download|response buffer timeout
patterns.description: Identifies HTTP SlowRead attacks where responses are read very slowly.

patterns.regex: SSL renegotiation|TLS renegotiation|multiple handshakes|excessive SSL handshakes|handshake flood|SSL resource exhaustion
patterns.description: Detects SSL/TLS renegotiation attacks that exhaust server resources with repeated handshakes.

patterns.regex: SSL DoS|HTTPS resource exhaustion|SSL session cache full|SSL handshake timeout|TLS resource limit
patterns.description: Identifies SSL/TLS-based denial of service attacks targeting the encryption process.

patterns.regex: cache bypass|cache-busting|random query strings|unique URL parameters|high cache miss ratio|excessive origin hits
patterns.description: Detects Layer 7 DDoS using cache-busting techniques to bypass CDN caching.

patterns.regex: WAF bypass|security rule evasion|rule bypass attempt|evasion technique|encoding bypass|signature evasion
patterns.description: Identifies attempts to bypass application security controls as part of a DDoS attack.

patterns.regex: host header attack|host header injection|HTTP host mismatch|multiple host headers|invalid host value
patterns.description: Detects HTTP Host header manipulation attacks.

patterns.regex: header flood|excessive headers|header count exceeded|header size limit|large cookie|large HTTP headers
patterns.description: Identifies HTTP requests with extremely large or numerous headers.

patterns.regex: bot detection evasion|browser fingerprint spoofing|headless browser detected|automation detection|bot signature|fake user-agent
patterns.description: Detects attempts to evade browser fingerprinting and bot detection.

patterns.regex: botnet coordination|C&C communication|distributed command pattern|botnet signature|coordinated attack pattern|synchronized requests
patterns.description: Identifies patterns indicating botnet coordination in DDoS attacks.

patterns.regex: QUIC flood|UDP.*QUIC|excessive QUIC requests|QUIC resource exhaustion|QUIC protocol abuse
patterns.description: Detects DDoS attacks using the QUIC protocol.

patterns.regex: WebSocket flood|WS connection flood|excessive WebSocket|WebSocket resource exhaustion|WS protocol abuse
patterns.description: Identifies DDoS attacks targeting WebSocket connections.

patterns.regex: API gateway flood|API limit exceeded|API rate limit|excessive API calls|API abuse pattern
patterns.description: Detects DDoS attacks specifically targeting API gateways.

patterns.regex: multiple attack vectors|combined attack|hybrid DDoS|sequential attack pattern|attack vector rotation
patterns.description: Identifies multi-vector DDoS attacks using multiple techniques simultaneously.

patterns.regex: IoT botnet|Mirai signature|Mirai variant|IoT malware pattern|botnet command signature
patterns.description: Detects signatures associated with known IoT botnets like Mirai and its variants.

patterns.regex: reflection attack|SSDP reflection|NTP reflection|DNS reflection|Memcached reflection|amplification factor
patterns.description: Identifies reflection/amplification attacks using various UDP protocols.
Detects denied UDP traffic.
Detects multiple log entries with identical timestamps.
Detects high request rates indicating DDoS.
Identifies server resource exhaustion.

patterns.regex: Potential DDoS attack|distributed denial of service|attack detected.*requests.*IPs
patterns.description: Matches explicit DDoS alerts.

patterns.regex: Rate limiting triggered|Firewall rule applied|connections dropped
patterns.description: Detects DDoS mitigation actions.
Detects alert messages indicating SSRF, command injection, or other attacks.
Detects multiple TCP SYN packets without corresponding ACKs, indicating a SYN flood attack.
Detects incomplete HTTP GET requests without Host headers, sent repeatedly, indicating a Slowloris attack.
Detects 5+ rapid GET requests to the login endpoint, indicating an application-layer flood.
Detects large UDP packets from NTP port 123, indicating a non-DNS reflection attack.
Detects multiple fragmented IP packets, indicating a fragmented packet flood.
Detects allowed traffic from blacklisted IPs, indicating a firewall misconfiguration.
Detects inconsistent TTL values from the same source IP, indicating potential IP spoofing.
Detects attack traffic from internal IP addresses, indicating a compromised internal host.
Detects connection limit exceedances without mitigation, indicating resource misconfiguration.
Detects attack traffic targeting SSH port 22, indicating an exposed service vulnerability.
Detects HTTP/2 CONTINUATION frames without END_HEADERS, indicating a CONTINUATION flood attack.
Detects denied requests to Apache HTTP Server versions 2.4.0â€“2.4.51, vulnerable to DoS (CVE-2022-22720, CVE-2022-22721).
Detects multiple TCP ACK packets in rapid succession, indicating a TCP ACK flood attack.
Detects multiple HTTP/2 RST_STREAM frames in rapid succession, indicating a Rapid Reset attack (CVE-2023-44487).
Detects successful requests to admin or management endpoints, indicating an exposed management interface.
Detects 10+ rapid GET requests without rate limiting triggered, indicating a rate limiting misconfiguration.
Detects multiple TCP packets with zero window size, indicating a TCP Zero Window attack.
